intro: Viola tricolor f. excelsa, commonly known as the purple heart viola, is a cultivar of the common violet. It is characterized by its distinctive heart-shaped leaves and flowers with three different-colored petals—typically violet, white, and yellow. This variety is prized for its ornamental value in gardens and its ability to thrive in cool, moist conditions. It is a perennial plant that produces showy blooms in early spring. The plant prefers partial shade and well-drained soil, making it a versatile choice for woodland gardens.
